channel.title: image processing on Jared Rosario
channel.description: Recent content in image processing on Jared Rosario

item.title: CS 469 Notes 00
item.description: What is Digital Image Processing? Image - a 2D function f(x,y) where x and y represent the coordinates. f would be the amplitude for the given coordinates x and y. NOTE: the 2D function f(x,y) (amplitude) is called the intensity/gray level of the image. An image is considered a digital image when x, y, and intensity of values are all finite and discrete. NOTE: for an analog image: x, y, and intensity of values are continuous.
